Title: Application Start-Up Procedure
Implementation: Implementation of \texttt{CrFwAppStartUpProc.h}. Only a test stub is provided as default at framework level.
DefaultValue: No default provided at framework level

Title: Application Reset Procedure
Implementation: Implementation of \texttt{CrFwAppResetProc.h}. Only a test stub is provided as default at framework level.
DefaultValue: No default provided at framework level

Title: Application Shutdown Procedure
Implementation: Implementation of \texttt{CrFwAppShutdownProc.h}. Only a test stub is provided as default at framework level.
DefaultValue: No default provided at framework level

Title: State Machine Embedded in state START\_UP of Application State Machine
Implementation: \texttt{\#DEFINE} constant in \texttt{CrFwAppSmUserPar.h}
DefaultValue: No state machine embedded in state START\_UP

Title: State Machine Embedded in state NORMAL of Application State Machine
Implementation: \texttt{\#DEFINE} constant in \texttt{CrFwAppSmUserPar.h}
DefaultValue: No state machine embedded in state NORMAL

Title: State Machine Embedded in state RESET of Application State Machine
Implementation: \texttt{\#DEFINE} constant in \texttt{CrFwAppSmUserPar.h}
DefaultValue: No state machine embedded in state RESET

Title: State Machine Embedded in state SHUTDOWN of Application State Machine
Implementation: \texttt{\#DEFINE} constant in \texttt{CrFwAppSmUserPar.h}
DefaultValue: No state machine embedded in state SHUTDOWN

Title: Initialization Check in Initialization Procedure of Base Component
Implementation: The Base Component is not available for direct use by application developers. This Adaptation Point is therefore not directly supported by the C2 Implementation but, where required, is supported by components which are derived from the Base Component.
DefaultValue: Always returns: 'check successful'

Title: Initialization Action in Initialization Procedure of Base Component
Implementation: The Base Component is not available for direct use by application developers. This Adaptation Point is therefore not directly supported by the C2 Implementation but, where required, is supported by components which are derived from the Base Component.
DefaultValue: Do nothing and return: 'action successful'

Title: Configuration Check in Reset Procedure of Base Component
Implementation: The Base Component is not available for direct use by application developers. This Adaptation Point is therefore not directly supported by the C2 Implementation but, where required, is supported by components which are derived from the Base Component.
DefaultValue: Always returns: 'check successful'

Title: Configuration Action in Reset Procedure of Base Component
Implementation: The Base Component is not available for direct use by application developers. This Adaptation Point is therefore not directly supported by the C2 Implementation but, where required, is supported by components which are derived from the Base Component.
DefaultValue: Do nothing and return: 'action successful'

Title: Shutdown Action of Base Component
Implementation: The Base Component is not available for direct use by application developers. This Adaptation Point is therefore not directly supported by the C2 Implementation but, where required, is supported by components which are derived from the Base Component.
DefaultValue: Do nothing

Title: Execution Procedure of Base Component
Implementation: The Base Component is not available for direct use by application developers. This Adaptation Point is therefore not directly supported by the C2 Implementation but, where required, is supported by components which are derived from the Base Component.
DefaultValue: Do the same dummy action (return without doing anything) whenever the procedure is executed

Title: \texttt{Make} Operation to dynamically instantiate a component
Implementation: The only components which can be instantiated dynamically are report and command components. Their \texttt{make} operations are implemented in full (see \texttt{CrFwInFactoryMake*} and \texttt{CrFwOutFactoryMakeOutCmp} functions). This adaptation point is therefore closed by the C2 Implementation.
DefaultValue: No default provided at framework level

Title: \texttt{Release} Operation to dynamically release a component
Implementation: The only components which can be released  dynamically are report and command components. Their \texttt{release} operations are implemented in full (see \texttt{CrFwInFactoryRelease*} and \texttt{CrFwOutFactoryReleaseOutCmp} functions). This adaptation point is therefore closed by the C2 Implementation.
DefaultValue: No default provided at framework level

Title: Initialization Check in Initialization Procedure of InCommand
Implementation: This Adaptation Point is closed in the C2 Implementation because InCommands are provided by the InFactory in the CONFIGURED state  (but a validity check is provided in C2-ICM-1 to implement the acceptance check).
DefaultValue: Returns 'check successful' if information for initializing InCommand using data in incoming packet is valid

Title: Initialization Action in Initialization Procedure of InCommand
Implementation: This Adaptation Point is closed in the C2 Implementation because InCommands are provided by the InFactory in the CONFIGURED state (but a validity check is provided in C2-ICM-1 to implement the acceptance check).
DefaultValue: Use information in incoming packet to initialize InCommand and return 'action successful'

Title: Configuration Check in Reset Procedure of InCommand
Implementation: This Adaptation Point is closed in the C2 Implementation because InCommands are provided by the InFactory in the CONFIGURED state (but a validity check is provided in C2-ICM-1 to implement the acceptance check).
DefaultValue: Returns 'check successful' if information carried by packet is valid

Title: Configuration Action in Reset Procedure of InCommand
Implementation: This Adaptation Point is closed in the C2 Implementation because InCommands are provided by the InFactory in the CONFIGURED state (but a validity check is provided in C2-ICM-1 to implement the acceptance check).
DefaultValue: Use information in incoming packet to configure InCommand and return 'action successful'

Title: Shutdown Action of InCommand (closes BAS-5)
Implementation: This Adaptation Point is closed at framework level.
DefaultValue: Same value as in Base Component

Title: Execution Procedure of InCommand (closes BAS-6)
Implementation: This Adaptation Point is closed at framework level.
DefaultValue: Same value as in Base Component

Title: Ready Check of InCommand
Implementation: Function pointer in \texttt{CrFwInFactoryUserPar.h}. Default implementation is provided by function \texttt{CrFwSmCheckAlwaysTrue}.
DefaultValue: Return 'command is ready'

Title: Start Action of InCommand
Implementation: Function pointer in \texttt{CrFwInFactoryUserPar.h}. Default implementation is provided by function \texttt{CrFwSmEmptyAction}.
DefaultValue: Set action outcome to 'success'

Title: Progress Action of InCommand
Implementation: Function pointer in \texttt{CrFwInFactoryUserPar.h}. Default implementation is provided by function \texttt{CrFwSmEmptyAction}.
DefaultValue: Set action outcome to 'completed'

Title: Termination Action of InCommand
Implementation: Function pointer in \texttt{CrFwInFactoryUserPar.h}. Default implementation is provided by function \texttt{CrFwSmEmptyAction}.
DefaultValue: Set action outcome to 'success'

Title: Abort Action of InCommand
Implementation: Function pointer in \texttt{CrFwInFactoryUserPar.h}. Default implementation is provided by function \texttt{CrFwSmEmptyAction}.
DefaultValue: Do nothing

Title: Operation to Report Start Failed for InCommand
Implementation: Implemented by Adaptation Point C2-ACK-1.
DefaultValue: Generate command acknowledge report CMD\_ACK\_STR\_FAIL with command's identifier and with identifier of reason of failure as parameters.

Title: Operation to Report Start Successful for InCommand
Implementation: Implemented by Adaptation Point C2-ACK-1.
DefaultValue: Generate command acknowledge report CMD\_ACK\_STR\_SUCC with command's identifier as parameter.

Title: Operation to Report Progress Failed for InCommand
Implementation: Implemented by Adaptation Point C2-ACK-1.
DefaultValue: Generate command acknowledge report CMD\_ACK\_PRG\_FAIL with command's identifier, progress step and with identifier of reason of failure as parameters.

Title: Operation to Report Progress Successful for InCommand
Implementation: Implemented by Adaptation Point C2-ACK-1.
DefaultValue: Generate command acknowledge report CMD\_ACK\_PRG\_SUCC with command's identifier and progress step as parameters.

Title: Operation to Report Termination Failed for InCommand
Implementation: Implemented by Adaptation Point C2-ACK-1.
DefaultValue: Generate command acknowledge report CMD\_ACK\_TRM\_FAIL with command's identifier and with identifier of reason of failure as parameters.

Title: Operation to Report Report Termination Successful for InCommand
Implementation: Implemented by Adaptation Point C2-ACK-1.
DefaultValue: Generate command acknowledge report CMD\_ACK\_TRM\_FAIL with command's identifier as parameter.

Title: Service Type Attribute of InCommand
Implementation: Implemented by Adaptation Point C2-IFA-4.
DefaultValue: No default provided at framework level

Title: Command Sub-Type Attribute of InCommand
Implementation: Implemented by Adaptation Point C2-IFA-4.
DefaultValue: No default provided at framework level

Title: Discriminant Attribute of InCommand
Implementation: Implemented by Adaptation Point C2-IFA-4.
DefaultValue: Default value is: 'no discriminant'

Title: Parameter Attributes of InCommand
Implementation: This Adaptation Point is implemented indirectly: applications must extend InCommands and must define the range of parameters for each kind of InCommand and the operations to get their values.
DefaultValue: Default value is: 'no parameters'

Title: Initialization Check in Initialization Procedure of InLoader (closes BAS-1)
Implementation: This Adaptation Point is closed at framework level by using the default component initialization check. The LIM is defined implicitly in the function through which the InManager is selected (see adaptation point \#AdaptPoint:AP-ILD:17).
DefaultValue: Return 'check successful' iff the sizes of the LIM is a positive integer

Title: Initialization Action in Initialization Procedure of InLoader (closes BAS-2)
Implementation: This Adaptation Point is closed at framework level by using the default component initialization action. The LIM is defined implicitly in the function through which the InManager is selected (see adaptation point \#AdaptPoint:AP-ILD:17).
DefaultValue: Allocate resources for the LIM and return 'Action Successful' iff the allocation succeeds

Title: Configuration Check in Reset Procedure of InLoader (closes BAS-3)
Implementation: This Adaptation Point is closed at framework level by using the default component configuration check. The LIM is defined implicitly in the function through which the InManager is selected (see adaptation point \#AdaptPoint:AP-ILD:17 ).
DefaultValue: Returns 'check successful' if: (a) the information to update (or initialize) the content of the LIM is valid; and (b) the information to re-route packets is valid.

Title: Configuration Action in Reset Procedure of InLoader (closes BAS-4)
Implementation: This Adaptation Point is closed at framework level by using the default component configuration check. The LIM is defined implicitly in the function through which the InManager is selected (see adaptation point \#AdaptPoint:AP-ILD:17 ).
DefaultValue: (a) update (or initialize) content of LIM; and (b) update (or initialize) packet re-routing information.

Title: Shutdown Action of InLoader (closes BAS-5)
Implementation: This Adaptation Point is closed at framework level.
DefaultValue: Same as in Base Component.

Title: Execution Procedure of InLoader (closes BAS-6)
Implementation: This Adaptation Point is closed at framework level.
DefaultValue: Implemented as InLoader Execution Procedure.

Title: Size of List of InManagers in InLoader
Implementation: The InLoader of the C2 Implementation does not explicitly define a List of InManager. This Adaptation Point is subsumed in the Adaptation Point for the selection of the InManager (\#AdaptPoint:AP-ILD:17).
DefaultValue: Default size is 2.

Title: Content of List of InManagers in InLoader
Implementation: The InLoader of the C2 Implementation does not explicitly define a List of InManager. It only defines the function to return the InManager where the InReport or InCommand must be loaded (see \#AdaptPoint:AP-ILD:17).
DefaultValue: No default provided at framework level.

Title: Operation to Determine Re-Routing Destination of Packets
Implementation: Function pointer in \texttt{CrFwInLoaderUserPar.h}. Default implementation is provided \texttt{CrFwInLoader.h}.
DefaultValue: Re0routing destination is set to the destination of the incoming packet.

Title: Operation to Get Packet Destination
Implementation: Implemented by Adaptation Point \#AdaptPoint:C2-PCK:01
DefaultValue: No default provided at framework level.

Title: Operation to Check Packet Destination Validity
Implementation: The check of the destination validity is performed by the function which returns the re-routing destination.
DefaultValue: Always returns 'destination is valid'.

Title: Operation to Report Packet Destination Invalid
Implementation: Implemented by Adaptation Point \#AdaptPoint:C2-ERR:01
DefaultValue: Generate error report INLOADER\_INV\_DEST with the destination identifier as a parameter

Title: Operation to Get Packet Type
Implementation: Implemented by Adaptation Point \#AdaptPoint:C2-PCK:01
DefaultValue: No default provided at framework level

Title: Operation to Report Acceptance Failure
Implementation: Implemented by Adaptation Point C2-ACK-1.
DefaultValue: For InCommands: generate command acknowledge report CMD\_ACK\_ACC\_FAIL with command's identifier and with identifier of reason of failure as parameters.. For InReports: generate error report INLOADER\_ACC\_FAIL with report's identifier and with identifier of reason of acceptance failure as parameters.

Title: Operation to Report Acceptance Success
Implementation: Implemented by Adaptation Point C2-ACK-1.
DefaultValue: Generate command acknowledge report CMD\_ACK\_ACC\_SUCC with command's identifier as parameter.

Title: Operation to Deserialize Packet
Implementation: Packets are not deserialized in the C2 Implementation. Instead, the packet itself is attached to the component encapsulating the incoming report or command. This adaptation point is closed in the C2 Implementation.
DefaultValue: No default provided at framework level.

Title: Operation to Select InManager where Incoming Report or Command is Loaded
Implementation: Function pointer in \texttt{CrFwInLoaderUserPar.h}. Default implementation is provided \texttt{CrFwInLoader.h}.
DefaultValue: For InCommands, select first InManager in LIM; for InReport, select second InManager in LIM.

Title: Operation to Check Packet Type Validity
Implementation: This check is implemented in function \texttt{CrFwInFactoryMakeInCmd} for incoming command and in function \texttt{CrFwInFactoryMakeInRep} for incoming report. These functions check that the type is supported by the application.
DefaultValue: No default provided at framework level

Title: Size of PCRL of InManager
Implementation: \texttt{\#DEFINE} constants (one for each InManager) in \texttt{CrFwInManagerUserPar.h}
DefaultValue: Default size is 1.

Title: Initialization Check in Initialization Procedure of InManager (closes BAS-1)
Implementation: This Adaptation Point is closed at framework level. The check on the PCRL size is done as part of the InManager configuration checks in function \texttt{CrFwAuxInManagerConfigCheck} (see section \ref{sec:ConfigCheck}).
DefaultValue: Returns 'check successful' if the size of the PCRL has been set to a positive integer value.

Title: Initialization Action in Initialization Procedure of InManager (closes BAS-2)
Implementation: This Adaptation Point is closed at framework level.
DefaultValue: Allocate resources for PCRL and return 'Action Successful' iff the allocation succeeds

Title: Configuration Check in Reset Procedure of InManager (closes BAS-3)
Implementation: This Adaptation Point is closed at framework level.
DefaultValue: Same as in Base Component

Title: Configuration Action in Reset Procedure of InManager (closes BAS-4)
Implementation: This Adaptation Point is closed at framework level.
DefaultValue: Release all InCommands and InReports in the PCRL; reset the counter of successfully loaded InCommands and InReports; reset the PCRL; and return 'Action Successful'

Title: Shutdown Action of InManager (closes BAS-5)
Implementation: This Adaptation Point is closed at framework level.
DefaultValue: Release all InCommands and InReports in the PCRL; reset the PCRL;

Title: Execution Procedure of InManager (closes BAS-6)
Implementation: This Adaptation Point is closed at framework level.
DefaultValue: Implemented as InManager Execution Procedure.

Title: Operation to Report PCRL of InManager Full
Implementation: Implemented by Adaptation Point \#AdaptPoint:C2-ERR:01
DefaultValue: Generate INMANAGER\_PCRL\_FULL Error Report

Title: Maximum Number of Trackable InCommands/InReports in InRegistry
Implementation: \texttt{\#DEFINE} constant in \texttt{CrFwInRegistryUserPar.h}
DefaultValue: Default value is 1.

Title: Initialization Check in Initialization Procedure of InRegistry (closes BAS-1)
Implementation: This Adaptation Point is closed at framework level. The maximum number of trackable InCommands/InReports is a statically defined configuration parameter of the framework. Hence, the check required by this requirement is performed Configuration Check Function \texttt{CrFwAuxInRegistryConfigCheck} (see section \ref{sec:ConfigCheck} of reference [CR-UM]). This configuration check is therefore implemented to always return ?check successful?.
DefaultValue: Returns 'check successful' if the maximum number of trackable InCommands/InReports has been set to a positive integer value.

Title: Initialization Action in Initialization Procedure of InRegistry (closes BAS-2)
Implementation: This Adaptation Point is closed at framework level.
DefaultValue: Allocate the resources for tracking the commands and reports and returns: 'action successful' if the allocation succeeds or 'action failed' if the allocation fails.

Title: Configuration Check in Reset Procedure of InRegistry (closes BAS-3)
Implementation: This Adaptation Point is closed at framework level.
DefaultValue: Same value as in Base Component

Title: Configuration Action in Reset Procedure  (closes BAS-4)
Implementation: This Adaptation Point is closed at framework level.
DefaultValue: Clear all information about tracked InCommands and InReports; return: 'action successful'.

Title: Shutdown Action of InRegistry (closes BAS-5)
Implementation: This Adaptation Point is closed at framework level.
DefaultValue: Clear all information about tracked InCommands and InReports.

Title: Execution Procedure of InRegistry (closes BAS-6)
Implementation: This Adaptation Point is closed at framework level.
DefaultValue: Same value as in Base Component

Title: Initialization Check in Initialization Procedure of InReport
Implementation: This Adaptation Point is closed by the C2 Implementation because InReports are provided by the InFactory in the CONFIGURED state (but a validity check is provided in C2-ICM-1 to implement the acceptance check).
DefaultValue: Returns 'check successful' if information for initializing InReport using data in incoming packet is valid

Title: Initialization Action in Initialization Procedure of InReport
Implementation: This Adaptation Point is closed by the C2 Implementation because InReports are provided by the InFactory in the CONFIGURED state (but a validity check is provided in C2-ICM-1 to implement the acceptance check).
DefaultValue: Use information in incoming packet to initialize InReport and return 'action successful'

Title: Configuration Check in Reset Procedure of InReport
Implementation: This Adaptation Point is closed by the C2 Implementation because InReports are provided by the InFactory in the CONFIGURED state (but a validity check is provided in C2-ICM-1 to implement the acceptance check).
DefaultValue: Returns 'check successful' if information for configuring InReport using data in incoming packet is valid

Title: Configuration Action in Reset Procedure of InReport
Implementation: This Adaptation Point is closed by the C2 Implementation because InReports are provided by the InFactory in the CONFIGURED state (but a validity check is provided in C2-ICM-1 to implement the acceptance check).
DefaultValue: Use information in incoming packet to configure InReport and return 'action successful'

Title: Shutdown Action of InReport (closes BAS-5)
Implementation: This Adaptation Point is closed at framework level.
DefaultValue: Same value as in Base Component

Title: Execution Procedure of InReport (closes BAS-6)
Implementation: This Adaptation Point is closed at framework level.
DefaultValue: Same value as in Base Component

Title: Update Action of InReport
Implementation: Function pointer in \texttt{CrFwInFactoryUserPar.h}. Default implementation is provided at framework level.
DefaultValue: Do nothing

Title: Service Type Attribute of InReport
Implementation: Implemented by Adaptation Point C2-IFA-3.
DefaultValue: No default provided at framework level

Title: Sub-Type Attribute of InReport
Implementation: Implemented by Adaptation Point C2-IFA-3.
DefaultValue: No default provided at framework level

Title: Discriminant Attribute of InReport
Implementation: Implemented by Adaptation Point C2-IFA-3.
DefaultValue: Default value is: 'no discriminant'

Title: Parameter Attribute of InReport
Implementation: This Adaptation Point is implemented indirectly: applications must extend InCommands and must define the range of parameters for each kind of InCommand and the operations to get their values.
DefaultValue: Default value is: 'no parameters'

Title: Size of the Packet Queue in InStream
Implementation: \texttt{\#DEFINE} constant (one for each InStream in the application) in \texttt{CrFwInStreamUserPar.h}
DefaultValue: Default size is 1

Title: Initialization Check in Initialization Procedure of InStream
Implementation: Function pointers (one for each InStream in the application) in \texttt{CrFwInStreamUserPar.h}. Default implementation is provided in \texttt{CrFwInStream.h}. The size of the Packet Queue is a statically defined configuration parameter. The fact that it must be positive is checked by the Configuration Check Function \#CrFwAuxInStreamConfigCheck (see section \ref{sec:ConfigCheck}).
DefaultValue: Returns 'check successful' if the size of the Packet Queue has been set to a positive integer

Title: Initialization Action in Initialization Procedure of InStream
Implementation: Function pointers (one for each InStream in the application) in \texttt{CrFwInStreamUserPar.h}. Default implementation is provided in \texttt{CrFwInStream.h}.
DefaultValue: Allocate resources for Packet Queue and return 'Action Successful' iff the allocation succeeds

Title: Configuration Action in Reset Procedure of InStream
Implementation: Function pointers (one for each InStream in the application) in \texttt{CrFwInStreamUserPar.h}. Default implementation is provided in \texttt{CrFwInStream.h}.
DefaultValue: Reset the Packet Queue and return 'Action Successful'

Title: Shutdown Action of InStream
Implementation: Function pointers (one for each InStream in the application) in \texttt{CrFwInStreamUserPar.h}. Default implementation is provided in \texttt{CrFwInStream.h}.
DefaultValue: Reset the Packet Queue

Title: Execution Procedure of InStream (closes BAS-6)
Implementation: This Adaptation Point is closed at framework level.
DefaultValue: Same value as in Base Component

Title: Operation to Get Packet Source from Incoming Packet
Implementation: Implemented by Adaptation Point \#AdaptPoint:C2-PCK:01
DefaultValue: No value defined at framework level

Title: Operation to Get Packet Sequence Counter from Incoming Packet
Implementation: Implemented by Adaptation Point \#AdaptPoint:C2-PCK:01
DefaultValue: No value defined at framework level

Title: Operation to Report Sequence Counter Error
Implementation: Implemented by Adaptation Point \#AdaptPoint:C2-ERR:01
DefaultValue: Generate INSTREAM\_SC\_ERR Error Report with expected and actual sequence counter values

Title: Operation to Report Packet Queue Full
Implementation: Implemented by Adaptation Point \#AdaptPoint:C2-ERR:01
DefaultValue: Generate INSTREAM\_PQ\_FULL Error Report

Title: Packet Collect Operation for InStream
Implementation: Function pointers (one for each InStream in the application) in \texttt{CrFwInStreamUserPar.h}. Only a test stub is provided as default at framework level.
DefaultValue: No default defined at framework level

Title: Packet Available Check Operation for InStream
Implementation: Function pointers (one for each InStream in the application) in \texttt{CrFwInStreamUserPar.h}. Only a test stub is provided as default at framework level.
DefaultValue: No default defined at framework level

Title: Operation to get Group to which Incoming Packet belongs
Implementation: Implemented through adaptation point \#AdaptPoint:C2-PCK:01
DefaultValue: No default defined at framework level

Title: Initialization Check in Initialization Procedure of OutComponent
Implementation: OutComponents are provided by the OutFactory in the CONFIGURED state and cannot therefore be initialized and configured by the user. This adaptation point is closed in the C2 Implementation.
DefaultValue: Same value as in Base Component

Title: Initialization Action in Initialization Procedure of OutComponent
Implementation: OutComponents are provided by the OutFactory in the CONFIGURED state and cannot therefore be initialized and configured by the user. This adaptation point is closed in the C2 Implementation.
DefaultValue: Same value as in Base Component

Title: Configuration Check in Reset Procedure of OutComponent
Implementation: OutComponents are provided by the OutFactory in the CONFIGURED state and cannot therefore be initialized and configured by the user. This adaptation point is closed in the C2 Implementation.
DefaultValue: Same value as in Base Component

Title: Configuration Action in Reset Procedure of OutComponent
Implementation: OutComponents are provided by the OutFactory in the CONFIGURED state and cannot therefore be initialized and configured by the user. This adaptation point is closed in the C2 Implementation.
DefaultValue: Same value as in Base Component

Title: Shutdown Action in Base Component of OutComponent
Implementation: OutComponents are provided by the OutFactory in the CONFIGURED state and are not intended to be ever shut down. This adaptation point is closed in the C2 Implementation.
DefaultValue: Same value as in Base Component

Title: Execution Procedure of OutComponent (closes BAS-6)
Implementation: The OutComponents are not intended to be ever executed. This adaptation point is closed in the C2 Implementation.
DefaultValue: Same value as in Base Component

Title: Service Type Attribute of OutComponent
Implementation: This Adaptation Point is implemented by adaptation point OFA-2.
DefaultValue: No default provided at framework level

Title: Command/Report Sub-Type Attribute of OutComponent
Implementation: This Adaptation Point is implemented by adaptation point OFA-2.
DefaultValue: No default provided at framework level

Title: Destination Attribute of OutComponent
Implementation: This Adaptation Point is implemented by adaptation point OFA-2.
DefaultValue: No default provided at framework level

Title: Acknowledge Level Attribute of OutComponent
Implementation: This Adaptation Point is implemented by adaptation point C2-PCK-1.
DefaultValue: Default value is: 'no acknowledge required' (only relevant for OutCommands)

Title: Discriminant Attribute of OutComponent
Implementation: This Adaptation Point is implemented by adaptation point OFA-2.
DefaultValue: Default value is: 'no discriminant'

Title: Parameter Attribute of OutComponent
Implementation: This Adaptation Point is implemented indirectly: applications must extend OutComponents and must define the range of parameters for each OutComponent and the operations to set their values.
DefaultValue: Default value is: 'no parameters'

Title: Enable Check Operation of OutComponent
Implementation: \texttt{\#DEFINE} constants (one for each kind of OutComponent in the application) in \texttt{CrFwOutFactoryUserPar.h} define the pointer to the function implementing the operation. A default is provided a framework level.
DefaultValue: Query the OutRegistry for the enable status of the command or report encapsulated in the OutComponent and set value of isEnable accordingly

Title: Ready Check Operation of OutComponent
Implementation: \texttt{\#DEFINE} constants (one for each kind of OutComponent in the application) in \texttt{CrFwOutFactoryUserPar.h} define the pointer to the function implementing the operation. A default is provided a framework level.
DefaultValue: Set value of isReady flag to true

Title: Repeat Check Operation of OutComponent
Implementation: \texttt{\#DEFINE} constants (one for each kind of OutComponent in the application) in \texttt{CrFwOutFactoryUserPar.h} define the pointer to the function implementing the operation. A default is provided a framework level.
DefaultValue: Return `No Repeat`

Title: Update Action of OutComponent
Implementation: \texttt{\#DEFINE} constants (one for each kind of OutComponent in the application) in \texttt{CrFwOutFactoryUserPar.h} define the pointer to the function implementing the operation. A default is provided a framework level.
DefaultValue: Set Time Stamp of OutComponent to current time

Title: Serialize Operation of OutComponent
Implementation: \texttt{\#DEFINE} constants (one for each kind of OutComponent in the application) in \texttt{CrFwOutFactoryUserPar.h} define the pointer to the function implementing the operation. A default is provided a framework level.
DefaultValue: No default defined at framework level

Title: Operation to Report Invalid Destination of an OutComponent
Implementation: Implemented by Adaptation Point C2-ERR-1.
DefaultValue: Generate SNDPCKT\_INV\_DEST Error Report with invalid destination as a parameter

Title: Initialization Check in Initialization Procedure of OutLoader
Implementation: Function pointer in \texttt{CrFwOutLoaderUserPar.h}. Default implementation which always returns 'check successful' is provided in \texttt{CrFwOutLoader.h}. The LOM has been implicitly implemented in the operation to select the OutManager (see \#AdaptPoint:AP-OLD:07).
DefaultValue: Returns 'check successful' if the size of the LOM (List of OutManagers) has been set to a positive integer value.

Title: Initialization Action in Initialization Procedure  of OutLoader
Implementation: Function pointer in \texttt{CrFwOutLoaderUserPar.h}. Default implementation which takes no action is provided in \texttt{CrFwOutLoader.h}. The LOM has been implicitly implemented in the operation to select the OutManager (see \#AdaptPoint:AP-OLD:07).
DefaultValue: Allocate resources for LOM and return 'Action Successful' iff the allocation succeeds

Title: Configuration Check in Reset Procedure of OutLoader
Implementation: Function pointer in \texttt{CrFwOutLoaderUserPar.h}. Default implementation which always returns 'check successful' is provided in \texttt{CrFwOutLoader.h}. The LOM has been implicitly implemented in the operation to select the OutManager (see \#AdaptPoint:AP-OLD:07).
DefaultValue: Returns 'check successful' iff all the information is available to update (or initialize) the value of the LOM.

Title: Configuration Action in Reset Procedure of OutLoader
Implementation: Function pointer in \texttt{CrFwOutLoaderUserPar.h}. Default implementation which takes no action is provided in \texttt{CrFwOutLoader.h}. The LOM has been implicitly implemented in the operation to select the OutManager (see \#AdaptPoint:AP-OLD:07).
DefaultValue: Update (or initialize) the LOM and return 'Action Successful'

Title: Shutdown Action of OutLoader
Implementation: Function pointer in \texttt{CrFwOutLoaderUserPar.h}. Default implementation which takes no action is provided in \texttt{CrFwOutLoader.h}.
DefaultValue: Same as in Base Component.

Title: Execution Procedure of OutLoader (closes BAS-6)
Implementation: This Adaptation Point is closed at framework level.
DefaultValue: Same as in Base Component.

Title: OutManager Selection Operation
Implementation: Function pointer in \texttt{CrFwOutLoaderUserPar.h}. Default implementation which always returns the first OutManager in the LOM is provided in \texttt{CrFwOutLoader.h}.
DefaultValue: Select the first OutManager in the LOM

Title: OutManager Activation Operation
Implementation: Function pointer in \texttt{CrFwOutLoaderUserPar.h}. Default implementation which takes no action is provided in \texttt{CrFwOutLoader.h}.
DefaultValue: Do nothing

Title: Operation to set Set Time-Stamp in Outgoing Packets
Implementation: Implemented by Adaptation Point C2-PCK-1.
DefaultValue: No value defined at framework level

Title: Size of POCL of OutManager
Implementation: \texttt{\#DEFINE} constants (one for each OutManager) in \texttt{CrFwOutManagerUserPar.h}
DefaultValue: Default size is 1.

Title: Initialization Check in Initialization Procedure of OutManager (closes BAS-1)
Implementation: This Adaptation Point is closed at framework level. The check on the POCL size is done as part of the OutManager configuration checks in function \texttt{CrFwAuxOutManagerConfigCheck} (see section \ref{sec:ConfigCheck}).
DefaultValue: Returns 'check successful' if the size of the POCL has been set to a positive integer value.

Title: Initialization Action in Initialization Procedure of OutManager (closes BAS-2)
Implementation: This Adaptation Point is closed at framework level.
DefaultValue: Allocate resources for POCL and return 'Action Successful' iff the allocation succeeds

Title: Configuration Check in Reset Procedure of OutManager (closes BAS-3)
Implementation: This Adaptation Point is closed at framework level.
DefaultValue: Same as in Base Component

Title: Configuration Action in Reset Procedure  (closes BAS-4)
Implementation: This Adaptation Point is closed at framework level.
DefaultValue: Release all OutComponents in the POCL; reset the POCL; reset the counter of successfully loaded OutComponents; and return 'Action Successful'

Title: Shutdown Action in Base Component of OutManager (closes BAS-5)
Implementation: This Adaptation Point is closed at framework level.
DefaultValue: Release all OutComponents in the POCL; reset the POCL

Title: Execution Procedure in Base Component of OutManager (closes BAS-6)
Implementation: This Adaptation Point is closed at framework level.
DefaultValue: Implemented as procedure of Manager Execution Procedure

Title: Operation to Report POCL of OutManager Full
Implementation: Implemented by Adaptation Point \#AdaptPoint:C2-ERR:01
DefaultValue: Generate OUTMANAGER\_POCL\_FULL Error Report

Title: Maximum Number of Trackable Commands/Reports for OutRegistry
Implementation: \texttt{\#DEFINE} constant in \texttt{CrFwOutRegistryUserPar.h} defines types, sub-types and range of discriminant values supported by application.
DefaultValue: Default value is 1.

Title: Initialization Check in Initialization Procedure of OutRegistry (closes BAS-1)
Implementation: This Adaptation Point is closed at framework level. The maximum number of trackable commands/reports is a statically defined configuration parameter of the framework. Hence, the check required by this requirement is performed Configuration Check Function \texttt{CrFwAuxOutRegistryConfigCheck} (see section \ref{sec:ConfigCheck} of reference [CR-UM]). This configuration check is therefore implemented to always return ?check successful?.
DefaultValue: Returns 'check successful' if the maximum number of trackable commands/reports has been set to a positive integer value.

Title: Initialization Action in Initialization Procedure of OutRegistry (closes BAS-2)
Implementation: This Adaptation Point is closed at framework level.
DefaultValue: Allocate the resources for tracking the commands and reports and returns: 'action successful' if the allocation succeeds or 'action failed' if the allocation fails.

Title: Configuration Check in Reset Procedure of OutRegistry (closes BAS-3)
Implementation: This Adaptation Point is closed at framework level.
DefaultValue: Same value as in Base Component

Title: Configuration Action in Reset Procedure of OutRegistry (closes BAS-4)
Implementation: This Adaptation Point is closed at framework level.
DefaultValue: Set the enable state for all kinds of commands and reports to: 'enabled'; clear all information about tracked commands and reports; and return: 'action successful'.

Title: Shutdown Action of OutRegistry (closes BAS-5)
Implementation: This Adaptation Point is closed at framework level.
DefaultValue: Set the enable state for all kinds of commands and reports to: 'enabled'; clear all information about tracked commands and reports.

Title: Execution Procedure of OutRegistry (closes BAS-6)
Implementation: This Adaptation Point is closed at framework level.
DefaultValue: Same value as in Base Component

Title: Initialization Check in Initialization Procedure of OutStreamRegistry
Implementation: In the C2 Implementation, the OutStreamRegistry is not implemented as a separate component (it is merged with the OutStream). This adaptation point is closed in the C2 Implementation.
DefaultValue: Same value as in Base Component

Title: Initialization Action in Initialization Procedure of OutStreamRegistry
Implementation: In the C2 Implementation, the OutStreamRegistry is not implemented as a separate component (it is merged with the OutStream). This adaptation point is closed in the C2 Implementation.
DefaultValue: Same value as in Base Component

Title: Configuration Check in  Reset Procedure of OutStreamRegistry
Implementation: In the C2 Implementation, the OutStreamRegistry is not implemented as a separate component (it is merged with the OutStream). This adaptation point is closed in the C2 Implementation.
DefaultValue: Returns 'check successful' if the information to set up the link between the packet destinations and the OutStreams is available.

Title: Configuration Action in Reset Procedure of OutStreamRegistry
Implementation: In the C2 Implementation, the OutStreamRegistry is not implemented as a separate component (it is merged with the OutStream). This adaptation point is closed in the C2 Implementation.
DefaultValue: Set up and configure the link between the packet destinations and the OutStreams.

Title: Shutdown Action  of OutStreamRegistry (closes BAS-5)
Implementation: In the C2 Implementation, the OutStreamRegistry is not implemented as a separate component (it is merged with the OutStream). This adaptation point is closed in the C2 Implementation.
DefaultValue: Same value as in Base Component

Title: Execution Procedure of OutStreamRegistry (closes BAS-6)
Implementation: In the C2 Implementation, the OutStreamRegistry is not implemented as a separate component (it is merged with the OutStream). This adaptation point is closed in the C2 Implementation.
DefaultValue: Same value as in Base Component

Title: Get OutStream Operation of OutStreamRegistry
Implementation: \texttt{\#DEFINE} constants \texttt{CR\_FW\_OUTSTREAM\_DEST\_PAIRS} in \texttt{CrFwOutStreamUserPar.h} defines the destinations associated to each OutStream.
DefaultValue: No default provided at framework level

Title: Packet Queue Size for OutStream
Implementation: \texttt{\#DEFINE} constant (one for each OutStream in the application) in \texttt{CrFwOutStreamUserPar.h}
DefaultValue: No value defined at framework level

Title: Initialization Check in Initialization Procedure of OutStream
Implementation: This adaptation point is closed at framework level. Function pointers (one for each OutStream in the application) in \texttt{CrFwOutStreamUserPar.h}. Default implementation is provided in \texttt{CrFwCmpBase.h}. The size of the Packet Queue is a statically defined configuration parameter. The fact that it must be positive is checked by the Configuration Check Function \texttt{CrFwAuxOutStreamConfigCheck} (see section \ref{sec:ConfigCheck} of reference [CR-UM]).
DefaultValue: Returns 'check successful' if the size of the Packet Queue has been set to a positive integer

Title: Initialization Action in Initialization Procedure of OutStream
Implementation: Function pointers (one for each OutStream in the application) in \texttt{CrFwOutStreamUserPar.h}. Default implementation is provided in \texttt{CrFwOutStream.h}.
DefaultValue: Allocate resources for the Packet Queue and return 'Action Successful'

Title: Configuration Check in Initialization Procedure of OutStream
Implementation: Function pointers (one for each OutStream in the application) in \texttt{CrFwOutStreamUserPar.h}. Default implementation is provided in \texttt{CrFwCmpBase.h}.
DefaultValue: Same value as in Base Component

Title: Configuration Action in Reset Procedure of OutStream
Implementation: Function pointers (one for each OutStream in the application) in \texttt{CrFwOutStreamUserPar.h}. Default implementation is provided in \texttt{CrFwOutStream.h}.
DefaultValue: Reset the Packet Queue and return 'Action Successful'

Title: Shutdown Action of OutStream
Implementation: Function pointers (one for each OutStream in the application) in \texttt{CrFwOutStreamUserPar.h}. Default implementation is provided in \texttt{CrFwOutStream.h}..
DefaultValue: Reset the Packet Queue and release the memory allocated to it

Title: Execution Procedure of OutStream (closes BAS-6)
Implementation: This Adaptation Point is closed at framework level.
DefaultValue: Same value as in Base Component

Title: Packet Hand-Over Operation of OutStream
Implementation: Function pointers (one for each OutStream in the application) in \texttt{CrFwOutStreamUserPar.h}. Only a test stub is provided as default at framework level.
DefaultValue: No value defined at framework level

Title: Operation to set Sequence Counter in Outgoing Packets
Implementation: Implemented by Adaptation Point C2-PCK-1.
DefaultValue: No value defined at framework level

Title: Operation to set Type Counter in Outgoing Packets
Implementation: Implemented by Adaptation Point C2-PCK-1
DefaultValue: No value defined at framework level

Title: Type Counter Set DST\_SET
Implementation: Function \texttt{CrFwOutStreamDefSetDTS} serves as a test stub which builds the DTS\_SET based on the destination identifier being equal to 1 and using all (service type, service sub-type) pairs defined in \texttt{CR\_FW\_OUTCMP\_INIT\_KIND\_DESC}.
DefaultValue: No value defined at framework level

Title: Operation to Report Packet Queue Full
Implementation: Implemented by Adaptation Point C2-ERR-1.
DefaultValue: Generate OUTSTREAM\_PQ\_FULL Error Report

Title: Operation to Compute and Set a Packet's CRC
Implementation: Implementation of function \texttt{CrFwComputeAndSetCrc} in interface \texttt{CrFwPckt.h}. Only a test stub is provided by default at framework level.
DefaultValue: Set CRC to 0xFFFF

Implementation: Implemented through adaptation point \#AdaptPoint:C2-PCK:01
DefaultValue: No value defined at framework level
